title: Part A
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria and/or examples, and to score the response.

One point for stating that the method shown in Image 1 requires more labor than the method shown in Image 2.

Two points for comparing the differences between the specific labor inputs shown in Image 1 and Image 2.
descriptions: The response does not correctly explain one of the following comparisons of how the methods of sugarcane production differ in terms of their labor inputs:
The response correctly states one of the following comparisons of how the methods of sugarcane production differ in terms of their labor inputs:
The response correctly explains one of the following comparisons of how the methods of sugarcane production differ in terms of their labor inputs:

title: Part B
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria and/or examples, and to score the response.

One point for stating that colonizers brought sugar to colonies in the Americas and Africa.

Two points for explaining how the colonial resource and mercantile trade systems of European colonial powers relocated sugar to new production regions and market areas.
descriptions: The response does not correctly explain how one of the following processes of colonialism contributed to the diffusion of sugarcane from its hearth of domestication:
The response correctly states how the following process of colonialism contributed to the diffusion of sugarcane from its hearth of domestication:
The response correctly explains how one of the following processes of colonialism contributed to the diffusion of sugarcane from its hearth of domestication:

title: Part C
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria and/or examples, and to score the response.

One point for stating that chemicals or soil runoff may get into water supplies.

Two points for explaining that commercial agricultural production uses pesticides and chemical fertilizers and tills the soil in such a way that runoff from farms can alter the downstream aquatic environment and groundwater quality.
descriptions: The response does not correctly explain one of the following ways the type of sugarcane production shown in Image 2 may contribute to water pollution:
The response correctly states the following way the type of sugarcane production shown in Image 2 may contribute to water pollution:
The response correctly explains one of the following ways the type of sugarcane production shown in Image 2 may contribute to water pollution:

title: Part D
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria and/or examples, and to score the response.

One point for stating that increased education will create more job opportunities outside of the farm.

Two points for explaining the process by which women gain formal education and increase their employment, migration, economic, political, and social possibilities as a result.
descriptions: The response does not correctly explain one of the following ways how increased access to education for women is likely to affect women’s roles in agriculture within a developing country:
The response correctly states one of the following ways how increased access to education for women is likely to affect women’s roles in agriculture within a developing country:
The response correctly explains one of the following ways how increased access to education for women is likely to affect women’s roles in agriculture within a developing country:

title: Part E
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria and/or examples, and to score the response.

One point for stating that trade is affected by the political relations between states.

Two points for explaining that trade agreements between states will increase exports or that conflict between states will reduce exports.
descriptions: The response does not correctly explain one of the following ways how political relationships between countries may affect a country that exports sugarcane:
The response correctly states one of the following ways how political relationships between countries may affect a country that exports sugarcane:
The response correctly explains one of the following ways how political relationships between countries may affect a country that exports sugarcane:
